metadata.title: CVE-2016-5734 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
phpMyAdmin 4.0.x before 4.0.10.16, 4.4.x before 4.4.15.7, and 4.6.x before4.6.3 does not properly choose delimiters to prevent use of thepreg_replace e (aka eval) modifier, which might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary PHP code via a crafted string, as demonstrated by thetable search-and-replace implementation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
